contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "glory" represents the presence of Yahweh. Alternate translation: "so that he may show you the glory of his presence" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: so that his glory may appear to you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "glory" represents Yahweh's presence. Alternate translation: "Yahweh showed all the people the glory of his presence" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the glory of Yahweh appeared to all the people

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "house" represents the people. Alternate translation: "all the people of Israel" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the entire house of Israel

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "their unclean actions" represents the people who commit sinful actions. Alternate translation: "in the presence of people who commit sinful actions" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: in the presence of their unclean actions

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "profane" means to dishonor. The word "name" represents God himself. Alternate translation: "you must not dishonor your God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: you must not profane the name of your God

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the people groups already living in Canaan. Translate this so the term "nations" is clarified as people. Alternate translation: "the people of the nations defiled themselves" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the nations are defiled

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the words "nation" and "land" represent the people who live there. Many people practicing prostitution and other wicked deeds is spoken of as if the they have fallen into or become full of those things. Alternate translation: "the people will begin to practice prostitution and many wicked things" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: the nation will fall to prostitution and the land will become full of wickedness

contextId.occurrenceNote: God's name represents God and his reputation. Alternate translation: "dishonor my reputation" or "dishonor me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metaphor]])
contextId.glQuote: profane my holy name

contextId.occurrenceNote: The phrase "to close their eyes" implies they "cannot see." This speaks of ignoring something as not seeing. Alternate translation: "disregard" or "ignore" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: close their eyes to

contextId.occurrenceNote: This word "name" is used to represent Yahweh's character. Alternate translation: "not disgrace God's reputation" or "not disgrace their God" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: not disgrace the name of their God

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "profane" here means to dishonor. The word "name" represents Yahweh's character. Alternate translation: "dishonor my reputation" or "dishonor me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: profane my holy name

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "name" represents Yahweh himself and his reputation and "profane" means to remove the honor that belongs to God as Creator and Lord of the universe. Alternate translation: "You must not dishonor me, for I am holy" or "You must not dishonor my holy reputation" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: You must not profane my holy name

contextId.occurrenceNote: The requirement that people assemble to worship God on that day is spoken of as if that day were the assembly. Alternate translation: "a holy day, when you must assemble together to worship me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: a holy assembly

contextId.occurrenceNote: The requirement that people assemble on that day is spoken of as if that day were the assembly. Being set apart to Yahweh means that when they assemble, they must worship Yahweh. Alternate translation: "The seventh day is a day when you must assemble together to worship Yahweh" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: The seventh day is an assembly set apart to Yahweh

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "sword" represents enemy armies or enemy attacks. Alternate translation: "no armies will attack you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the sword will not pass through your land

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here the word "sword" represents an army or an attack from an army. Alternate translation: "I will bring an enemy army against you" or "I will cause an enemy army to attack you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: I will bring a sword on you

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "into the hand" means "into the control" and refers to defeat by their enemy. This can be stated in active form. Alternate translation: "I will deliver you into the hand of your enemy" or "I will allow your enemy to control you" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]] and [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-activepassive]])
contextId.glQuote: you will be delivered into the hand of your enemy

contextId.occurrenceNote: Listening represents obeying what he has said. Alternate translation: "If you do not obey me" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: If you do not listen to me

contextId.occurrenceNote: Because God would send an army to do these things, he speaks as if he would do them. Alternate translation: "I will send an enemy army to destroy ... cut down ... throw your corpses" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: I will destroy ... cut down ... throw your corpses

contextId.occurrenceNote: Because God would send armies to do these things, he speaks as if he would do them. Alternate translation: "I will send enemy armies to turn your cities into ruins and destroy your sanctuaries" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: I will turn your cities into ruins and destroy your sanctuaries

contextId.occurrenceNote: This represents sending armies to attack them. Alternate translation: "I will send enemy armies to attack you" or "I will send enemy armies to attack you with their swords" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: I will draw out my sword and follow you

contextId.occurrenceNote: The sword represents either someone who is ready to kill using a sword or an attack from an enemy army. Alternate translation: "as though you were fleeing from someone who was chasing you with a sword" or "as though you were fleeing from an enemy army" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: as though you were fleeing from the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: The sword represents either someone who is ready to kill using a sword or an attack from an enemy army. Alternate translation: "as though you were running away from someone who was chasing you with a sword" or "as though you were running away from an enemy army" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: as though you were running from the sword

contextId.occurrenceNote: Standing before the enemies represents not falling when the enemies attack and fighting against them. Alternate translation: "to resist your enemies when they attack you" or "to fight back against your enemies" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: to stand before your enemies

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "their fathers" represents their ancestors. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: their fathers' sins

contextId.occurrenceNote: The word "fathers" represents their ancestors. (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: their fathers' sin

contextId.occurrenceNote: This represents the knowledge of the nations. Alternate translation: "in the knowledge of the nations" or "and the nations knew about it" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: in the sight of the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: This represents the people of the nations. Alternate translation: "the people of the nations" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: the nations

contextId.occurrenceNote: Here "a homer of barley" represents a piece of land that would need one homer of barley in order to plant on all of it. Alternate translation: "a piece of land that requires one homer of barley in order to plant all of it will be valued at" or 'the value of land that requires one homer of barley will be" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: a homer of barley will be valued at

contextId.occurrenceNote: This refers to the way they would count their animals. Alternate translation: "when you count your animals by raising your shepherd rod and having them walk under it to the other side" or "when you count the animals" (See: [[rc://en/ta/man/translate/figs-metonymy]])
contextId.glQuote: whatever passes under the shepherd's rod
